questions.prompt: Posting vacation photos while you are away can lead to which of these?
Publicly releasing a person's identifying information that was retrieved from social networking site profiles is known as what?
Before the 2010 World Cup, cybercriminals sent emails claiming you won tickets to see the event. This is an example of what?
Someone gives you a USB drive or other electronic media that is preloaded with malware in the hope you will use the device and enable them to hack your computer.  This is an example of what?

answers: Sure, if you know and trust your friend
It's Ok if the site looks real
questions.prompt: You receive a message from a Facebook friend directing you to view a video on another site. When you follow the link, you get a message requiring you to download a newer version of software.  Should you download it?
